root: ^Pardon my roots, they keep trying to take hold everywhere, they may be a bit of a tripping hazard.
^I find myself sprouting new ones every day, this relocation can’t happen quickly enough.
^Where are you going? To the city?
^No, no, not at all. There isn’t any room for me there!
^I’m heading north, to where the land opens up.
^I found myself rooted in a small town not too far from here but I think the seasons may have been kinder to me than others.
^I found myself growing larger and larger, not able to be contained in the small patches of green where I was.
^I tried to move around, find someplace bigger, but no matter where I tried to settle in I was growing too large for!
^Finally, with winter bearing down on us soon I had to make the decision to uproot myself and find someplace where I will have plenty of room to grow.
^I need to settle in someplace and get my roots in deep before the frost.
^I think I kind of know the feeling of growing too big for someplace.
^I will miss my friends, the birds that made nests in the densest parts of me, the humans that would walk by and admire me.
^But the more I grew the birds could no longer build their nests in my brambles.
^And I grew so unwieldy that humans would avoid me at all costs, now looking at me with concern or disdain.
^It’s… a sad thing to grow and change and lose the things you love.
^But sometimes you can’t stop the change?
^Packing myself into the small spaces my roots were stifled, and my branches bowed to fit into the small spaces that would let me grow.
^But the contorting of me that needed to fit those spaces grew to painful, I fell so sickly, so limp, I was losing my colour.
^It is… I feared that if I didn’t make this move to uproot then I would have simply withered away…
^You can’t be expected to endure that.
^It will be strange to be someplace so far away from all I’ve known.
^But I know the space it can offer me, will let me grow to lengths I have not known before.
^I can feel parts of myself already budding, as if ready to bloom!
^I did not even know I could do that!
^Amazing! Though a bit late in the season for that I think.
^Truly, it’s a strange thing, but sometimes we don’t bloom until we are in the conditions we need to foster it.
^Yeah… I definitely know what that feels like.
^Is the soil dry where you are from? Do you get enough water?
^I do, but I don’t really mean like that, well, maybe a little.
^I take care of myself just fine. Just where I am…
^I think it’s more than a little stifling for me.
^Big plant in a small pot and all that.
^Let’s get you out of it post haste!
^Perhaps you can come with me north? Plenty of room to grow up there!
^Tempting, hah, but I think I need something else.
^A nutrient-rich environment is a health environment.
